title: Hearing and Seeing
provenance_text:
Heinz Trökes [1913-1997], Berlin, Germany and Ibiza, Spain [1]; Galerie Springer, Berlin, Germany [2]; G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA, January 1953 until December 1955 [3]; his gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1955.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 278 in "The 1952 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Paintings" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October-December 1952.
[2]. The gallery (Mr. Rudolf Springer) was the artist's agent
[3]. Mr. Thompson committed to purchasing the painting from the 1952 International for $150 in October 1952. Arrangements to pay for it were finalized in December 1952; payment was made in January 1953 and acknowledged by the gallery on January 30, 1953 (see curatorial file for copies of relevant correspondence.)
